      long real procedure Erlang (a,b,U); name U; long real a,b; integer U; The value is a drawing from the Erlang distribution with mean 1/a and standard deviation 1/(a*sqrt(b)).

      double ENVIRONMENT$.linear(ENVIRONMENT$.$ARRAY<double[]> A, ENVIRONMENT$.$ARRAY<double[]> B, ENVIRONMENT$.$NAME<java.lang.Integer> U)
      long real procedure linear (A,B,U); name U; array A,B; integer U; The value is a drawing from a (cumulative) distribution function F, which is obtained by linear interpolation in a non-equidistant table defined by A and B, such that A(i) = F(B(i)).
      double ENVIRONMENT$.negexp(double a, ENVIRONMENT$.$NAME<java.lang.Integer> U)
      long real procedure negexp (a,U); name U; long real a; integer U; The value is a drawing from the negative exponential distribution with mean 1/a, defined by -ln(u)/a, where u is a basic drawing.
